alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 13 at 8:41PM MDT until October 14 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FRIDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS... Breezy northwest winds will continue Friday as low pressure remains to the east. Meanwhile, strengthening high pressure over and west of Colorado will lead to warmer and drier conditions. The resulting combination will produce critical fire weather conditions during the afternoon hours, mainly for the northeast plains and in/near the Cheyenne Ridge and northern I-25 corridor. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM MDT FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE NORTHEASTERN COLORADO PLAINS... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 238, 242, 244, 248, 249, 250 and 251. * Timing...Friday from Noon to 6 PM. * Winds...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid any burning or outdoor activities that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are expected. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County
